updates.title: Removed packet checking
updates.text: Removed packet checking for position when sending packets to the device (This is to help mitigate poor performance if called to change light colours every tick... Not that you should)

updates.title: Health System Example
updates.text: Made an example video for usage cases, this is a health system where the user can have 3 lives and when damaged slowly decreases (The red is just damage box)

updates.title: Proximity Usage Example
updates.text:
Made an example video for usage cases, this is is for a proximity sensor in unreal engine.
(The delay is not that bad, my camera is a bit slow, i need a better one)

updates.title: Started implimenting recieving location data in UE
updates.text:
I've started working on recieving location data of character but inside of unreal engine

as a side note, unreal engine does not like waiting around for data.
Should I perhaps keep checking in the class then when called I can return the last known value?

updates.title: Initial Integration
updates.text: Successfully integrated the Disney Infinity Base with Unreal Engine blueprint projects

updates.title: Fixed all memory leaks
updates.text: Fixed all memory leaks within unreal engine when sending data wayyy too fast.

updates.title: Achieved Intial integration into unreal engine
updates.text: First working build into unreal engine.

updates.title: Recieving character data implimented
updates.text: Initial character data implimented to be able to read what is placed down.

updates.title: Recieving locationd data implimented
updates.text: Initial character location implimented to be able to read where an item is placed.

updates.title: Figured out light data
updates.text:
After a long time of brute forcing, I decided to pass through the device to my wii u to debug some base data that way.

This worked and allowed me to figure out how lights work.

updates.title: Started the project.
updates.text:
Started with dumping as much info and brute forcing packet sending until the device reacted in some kind of way.

I've noticed that when the device gets activated you can hear it scanning when placing cables ontop of it
